dt: {bc}a recording of an image or of moving images

dt.t: They often post {wi}videos{/wi} of the kids online.
You won't just have access to generic movies, TV shows, and other {wi}videos{/wi}. You'll see content from major brands …

dt: {bc}a recorded performance of a song often featuring an interpretation of the lyrics through visual images

dt.t: The opening images of the music {wi}video{/wi} … create a scary, dystopian feeling …
She goes over to the television and pops a {wi}video{/wi} into the VCR.

shortdef: a recording of an image or of moving images : such as
a recorded performance of a song often featuring an interpretation of the lyrics through visual images

{bc}being, relating to, or involving images on a television screen or computer display

dt: {bc}a camera that records video and usually audio

shortdef: a camera that records video and usually audio; especially : camcorder

dt: {bc}a circuit board in a computer system designed to generate output for the system's video display screen

shortdef: a circuit board in a computer system designed to generate output for the system's video display screen

dt: {bc}a small security camera that is designed for use on an exterior door, that includes or connects to a doorbell, and that often has a microphone and speaker {bc}{sx|doorbell camera||}

dt.t: {wi}Video doorbells{/wi} are security cameras that are built into a doorbell.

A {wi}video doorbell{/wi}, sometimes called a doorbell camera, is an outdoor camera placed on someone's front door, either battery-powered or hardwired into an existing doorbell and chime setup. The user gets notified via a mobile app either when someone pushes the doorbell, or when the camera detects motion or a person, depending on its artificial intelligence capabilities.

shortdef: a small security camera that is designed for use on an exterior door, that includes or connects to a doorbell, and that often has a microphone and speaker : doorbell camera

dt: {bc}an electronic game in which players control images on a video screen

shortdef: an electronic game in which players control images on a video screen

dt: {bc}the filming or videotaping of a television program (such as a documentary) so as to convey candid realism

shortdef: the filming or videotaping of a television program (such as a documentary) so as to convey candid realism
a place with many video games

dt: {bc}a very violent or offensive movie that is on video
